doc.title: China Banks (2Q preview), Korea Banks (BOK, FSS)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/JPM APAC FINANCIALS - China Banks 2Q preview Korea Banks BOK FSSJPM APAC FINANCIALS - China Banks 2Q preview Korea Banks_2025-08-29

passages.text: 2 key highlights today:

- CHINA BANKS: Katherine forecasts all Big 5 to show NP YoY growth (ABC 1288 HK the highest \(+4\%\) YoY) w/ NIM stabilization except BOC 3988 HK (flat), The latest "Flows & Liquidity" assesses that the China rally has been driven by domestic retail margin traders, inflows from foreign retail, and speculative investors, Matt See warns of consolidation risks, Katherine suggests barbell strategy of beta and yield.

- KOREA BANKS: BoK's slower-than-expected rate cut limits further downside risks to NIM, FSS governor headlines weigh on sentiment, but Jihyun Cho argues re-rating still in tact, OW on all three, her PT implies PBR 0.9x for KB (105560 KS), 0.8x for Shinhan (055550 KS) and Hana (086790 KS)

BankInsuranceDiversifiedMacro29-AugFriICBC, ABC, CCB, BOC, BoComm, PSBC, CMB, BOCHK, China Minsheng, China Everbright, Bank of Beijing, Mega FinancialChina ReHuatai, GF, Galaxy, GTJA, CICCTokyo CPI, India 2Q GDP, US PCE
Use the links below to jump straight to each section: Detailed Highlight Sector Key Newsflow Full Research Links
CHINA BANKS: 2Q Preview, Katherine forecasts all Big 5 to show NP YoY growth (ABC the highest \(+4\%\) YoY) w/ NIM stabilization except BOC (flat) (Katherine Lei: Link)

- Katherine forecasts the highest NP growth rate for ABC \(+4\%\) YoY vs lowest for BOC flat She forecasts all SOE banks to continue showing QoQ NIM contraction (China Banks 2Q preview: Link), but with signs of stabilization as the NFRA data (Link) suggested. (2Q NIM -3bps QoQ vs -6bps QoQ in 1Q)

- Barrell strategy: Katherine and the team suggests to have both beta (brokers) and yield (banks with still-high dividend spread) (China Financials: Link) While Katherine remains positive on China banks for their dividend yield spread, the spread is contracting. She recently downgraded ABC-A (601288 CH) from OW to N as its 25e 3.5% dividend yield is the lowest among the Big 5. (China Banks 2H25 outlook: Link) Flow... Thelatest "Flows & Liquidity" (Link) analyzes the recent rally has been supported by domestic retail margin traders, inflows from foreign retail investors, as well as speculative investors. Thematics spec Matt See flags the risk of China consolidation following a big SB outflow and above 50% increase in margin finance. (Link)

- Feedback: Are bank still attractive for their dividend yield when growth stocks started performing? Katherine's answer is yes (Link), but be selective on higher yield names like CMB-A (600036 CH, OW). Ping An Group (2318 HK, OW) in the

earnings call this week talked about their interest in investment growth stocks going forward. Figure 12: Despite share price rally, CSI300 banks' dividend yield is still meaningfully higher than other CGB) and higher than insurance companies maximum guarantee rate for the new non-par insurance pro
Source:Wind, Bloomberg Finance L.P.Note:TTM means trailing 12M.
Table 2: China banks' key operating metrics - 2Q25 estimates
Source: Company data, J.P. Morgan estimates.
KOREA BANKS: BoK's slower-than- expected rate cut limits further downside risks to NIM, FSS governor headlines weigh on sentiment but Jihyun Cho argues re- rating still in tact

- BoK left the base rate such at \(2.5\%\) as expected yesterday, Slower-than-expected rate cuts limit further downside risks to NIM Our economist Seok Gil Park last week trimmed his terminal rate forecast to factor in improving growth outlook, but his caPreamins more dovish vs consensus. Link (He now forecasts end-26 terminal \(1.75\%\) instead of \(1.5\%\) vs cons \(2\%\) . Jihyan uses his assumptions. Post-BoK yesterday, Seokgill kept his forecast of 3 more 25bp cut in Oct, 1Q, 3Q26, but with a risk of further delay. Link)

- Jihyun Cho reiterates OW on all three major banks, KB (105560 KS), Shinhan (055550 KS), and Hana (086790 KS) She thinks the re-rating rally is still intact. Her PT implies PBR 0.9x for KB and 0.8x for Shinhan and Hana based on \(9\%\) sustainable ROE for KB vs \(8.5\%\) for Shinhan/Hana. (Presentation: Link) EM strategist Rajiv Batra places Korea at the top of the pecking order (Korea > India > China > Taiwan > ASEAN) but warns crowding risks, i.e. KB Financial (105560 KS, OW) is among the most owned by EM/Asia LOs. Link) (Korea Presentation slide: Link)

- Feedback: While investors continue assessing the upside on payout and re-rating (possible RWA growth resumption), there are also questions on regulatory outlook esp under the new FSS governor Lee Chan-jin. FSS's official release published yesterday (Link) following the new FSS Governor Lee's meeting w/ bank CEOs echoed the President's recent comment, i.e.
Figure 1: Fed funds rate vs BoK base rate
Source: Bloomberg Finance LP, J.P. Morgan estimates.
PPOP downside risk in event of additional 50bps cut
Source: Company data, J.P. Morgan estimates.

- Hong Kong official, lawmaker pull out of Bitcoin Asia 2025 featuring Eric Trump (SCMP)- Guotai Junan Intl Launches Virtual Assets Trading Services in HK (Bloomberg)- China Nudges Yuan to Strengthen as Economic Optimism Grows (Bloomberg)- Xi Sharpens Mission for Bloc Built to Rival US-Led World Order Shanghai (Bloomberg)- Modi to Secure Japan Investment, Supply Deals During Key Visit (Bloomberg)- CPIC: Zhu Yonghong Resigns Board Of Supervisors Chair (Link)- Security Bankseals P11.59-billion investment for 25% stake in Home Credit Philippines (Manila Standard)- ANZRushes Banker Layoffs After Automated Email Mistake (Bloomberg)- Infosys, Mastercard Collaborate to Streamline Cross-Border Payments (MT Newswires)

- Korea Banks - BoK holds policy rate unchanged; limited downside risks to NIM amid improving macro- Jihyun Cho (Link)- Bank of Queensland (BOQ AU) - "Accelerating industry headwinds" at odds with recent peer results; retain UW- Andrew Triggs (Link)- Bank of Queensland (BOQ AU) - Removal of FY26 ROE/CTI targets, trading update, more one-off costs, whole-of-loan sale potential flagged- Andrew Triggs (Link)- RHB Bank Bhd (RHBANK MK) - Core lines broadly steady, treasury drives a 2Q beat- Harsh Wardhan Modi (Link)- Industrial Bank - A (601166 CH) - 2Q25 results: Profit growth turning positive with stable AQ, but a miss on NIM- Katherine Lei (Link)- Huaxia Bank - A (600015 CH) - 2Q25 results: Profits contraction narrowed in 2Q, but core earnings trends weakened- Katherine Lei (Link)- Sompo Holdings (8630 JP) - Follow-up: Key takeaways from briefing on Aspen acquisition agreement- Koki Sato (Link)- New China Life Insurance - H (1336 HK) - First Take: Strong beat in 1H25, partially bolstered by favourable financial market movements- MW Kim (Link)
- DB Insurance Co Ltd (005830 KS) - Post-2Q25 results call takeaways: completion of hybrid bond issuance and strong solvency capital- MW Kim (Link)
- Noah Holdings Ltd (NOAH US) - 2Q25 First Take- Peter Zhang (Link)
- Perpetual Limited (PPT AU) - FY25 Result: WM sale pressured, but CT strong. AM mixed - cost out key to improve near-term trends. Valuation support exists- Siddharth Parameswaran (Link)
- Steadfast Group LTD (SDF AU) - FY25 result: Softer cycle more than offset by cost controls into FY26- Siddharth Parameswaran (Link)
- Medibank Private Limited (MPL AU) - FY25 result: Softer premium growth, but low claims growth an offset- Siddharth Parameswaran (Link)
- Medibank Private Limited (MPL AU) - FY25 conference call feedback- Siddharth Parameswaran (Link)
- The Antipodean Strategist - Smoke and mirrors- Ben K Jarman (Link)
- India: July IP surprises positively, but headwinds to build - - Divyanit Sood (Link)
- Philippines: BSP lowers policy rate in August - Less dovish tone due to upside risk to rice prices; Maintain 4.5% terminal rate, but push out next two cuts- Jin Tik Ngai (Link)
- Korea: BoK to remain on easing cycle for now - - Seok Gil Park (Link)
- India: Impact of US tariffs to grow over time - Toshi Jain (Link)
